author: sky.cactus
content: <@551157969367334912> I agree, your EIP isn't the right place for the discussion.  ðŸ˜„

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm not against Good Ideas having a place to live, I just don't like them living in the EIPs repository.  Editors are way overtaxed already and anything that can be done to limit the scope of the EIPs repository and avoid introducing politics into that repository is a good idea I think.

author: poojaranjan
content: Date & Time: Wednesday, Oct 07, 2020, at 15:00 UTC

author: sky.cactus
content: I finally got a chance to look at the readme <@!425279588009246720>, it just points at a GitHub repository that has no readme and a couple python files: <https://github.com/eip-automerger/automerger>

author: sky.cactus
content: Presumably that is running somewhere and someone needs to kick a box?

author: axic3354
content: It runs on appengine, on @arachnid's account I presume. You can ping it via HTTP, see the URL in the travis config of the EIPs repo. You need to pass the PR number to it.

author: axic3354
content: I'd really suggest to get the github actions version done as opposed to trying to fix the appengine version.

author: sky.cactus
content: I do not have the bandwidth for that, and am hoping that kicking a box is a 2 minute job for someone to get it back to operational.

author: sky.cactus
content: Maybe <@!187490121698770945> knows how to get in touch with Arachnid these days (I don't)?

author: axic3354
content: Only arachnid has access to the google appengine account this runs on.

author: axic3354
content: I tried registering to it myself to see if it can be easily moved but it is a paid service.

author: axic3354
content: Perhaps the github API changed and it can no longer resolve it.

author: sky.cactus
content: Ooh, bot just ran.  I guess someone fixed it.

author: sky.cactus
content: I'll go through and kick all of the PRs that look like they need the bot's touch tomorrow.
